titleStmt.title: Die Lunæ, 18 Septemb. 1643. Whereas Thomas Andrewes, John Fowke, Richard Chambers, William Barkley, Aldermen of the city of London; Maurice Thompson, Francis Allen, James Russell, and Stephen Estwick, merchants, are ordained and constituted to be collectors and commissioners, enabled to receive all such summes of money as should bee paid for customes ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Laurence Blaikelock, at the Temble-Barre [sic],

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
"23 Martii, 1643 [i.e. 1644]. Ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament that this ordinance be forthwith printed and published. H. Elsynge Cler. Parl. D. Com."
Imperfect: tightly bound with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library.
